sentences.sContent: Mr. Frankfurt spent much of his childhood in Brooklyn, and still sees himself as a disputatious Brooklynite - one who still speaks of the Dodgers as "having betrayed us.
sentences.sContent_eng: Mr. Frankfurt spent much of his childhood in Brooklyn, and still sees himself as a disputatious Brooklynite - one who still speaks of the Dodgers as "having betrayed us.
sentences.sCn: 法兰克福先生讲了很多有关于他在布鲁克林的童年，并且仍然认为自己是一个好辩的布鲁克林人——那种仍然会将欺骗者说成是背叛者的人。

words.tran: 好争论的；爱争辩的；有关争论的
争论；激烈争辩（dispute的过去分词）
